author: gstein
msg: Continued cleaning/reorg of the access baton code. The current goal is
to strongly isolate the access->shared structure. It will eventually
disappear in favor of simply using the wc_db.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/lock.c:
(pool_cleanup): adjust call to do_close()
(get_from_shared): new helper to grab an access baton from the shared
set of batons.
(svn_wc_adm_open3): use get_from_shared
(svn_wc__adm_retrieve_internal): use get_from_shared. reorg control flow
for clarity.
(join_batons): doc an important note
(do_close): remove RECURSE parameter. all callers passed TRUE, once we
started using close_single instead of truly recursing. screw the whole
sorting stuff. all that is important is closing *only* descendents. if
we fail, then we  fail. we don't have to close the "deepest ones first".
(svn_wc_adm_close2): adjust call to do_close
(svn_wc__adm_missing): use new get_from_shared helper.

author: gstein
msg: Shift some functionality around for open/close of a single access baton.
The recursion aspects are kept separately.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/lock.c:
(check_format_upgrade): accept a wc_format rather than fetching it.
(open_single): factored out of do_open(). tweaked to use two-pools.
(close_single): factored out of do_close().
(do_open): shift functionality to open_single
(do_close): shift functionality to close_single. remove wickedly
obsolete comment in the docstring.

author: rhuijben
msg: * STATUS: Vote on r37117, "Clear that pool!"

author: rhuijben
msg: * STATUS: Nominate r37121 for 1.6.2

author: gstein
msg: Some tweaks to svn_wc_adm_open_anchor to make it a bit clearer. Not a lot
of hope here, but whatevs.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/lock.c:
(child_is_disjoint): concept and a bit of the pattern pulled out of
svn_wc_adm_open_anchor. a bit longer, but hopefully clearer. this will
probably change faster (and more easily) as we move to wc_db
(svn_wc_adm_open_anchor): rejigger a bit of logic for clarity, and move
some code to child_is_disjoint.
